intro: Memecylon agusanense, commonly known as the Agusan memecylon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, particularly found in the provinces of Agusan and other parts of Mindanao. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged opposite each other on the stems. It produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, often in shades of white or pale yellow. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small seeds, which are dispersed by wind or water.
